reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were doing a mini road trip throughout northwest France and thought St. Brice seemed liked a good half-way point between the Loire Valley and Mont St. Michel. We pulled up to this lovely bed and breakfast and were immediately taken in by the charm of the grounds and home. We also stayed in the Cote Parc, which gave us the feeling of being tucked away in an old castle. The home has been lovingly restored - my favorite was the old tower staircase - and is impeccably kept.
reviews.title: Wonderful hosts, beautiful home!

likes.disliked: — There was nothing not to like

reviews.text: Our hosts could not have been warmer and friendlier. We enjoyed a delicious dinner with them and learned we were the first Americans they had ever hosted! The honor is all ours. If you take dinner with the hosts, be sure to check out the coat of arms in the fireplace from the 17th century.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, wonderful people

likes.disliked: — There was nothing not to like
